ygData.subject: Re: Trouble Grouping
ygData.msgSnippet: Unfortunately this is because almost everyone turns off OOC because it is usually a regular Spam-A-Rama going on on the OOC network. I know my party had it
ygData.messageBody:
Unfortunately this is because almost everyone turns off OOC because it is
usually a regular Spam-A-Rama going on on the OOC network.

I know my party had it turned off before 3rd level because of the annoyance
and foul language.

Use shout once, then start doing a /who 9 11 and then sending them private
tells, "Hey need a bard in your party?" or "Wanna team up with a 9th level
bard, I can heal, I can do AoE Damage, we can outrun monsters, we can make
sweet beautiful music together"

Or something else like that.

Wenaddar 16th level Bard


> -----Original Message-----
> From: Tanthalias [SMTP:tanthalas@...]
> Sent: Sunday, June 20, 1999 10:12 AM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: [eqbards] Trouble Grouping
>
> Lately, I'm having serious trouble finding a group. I'm a level 10 bard on
> Tarew Marr. Lately I've been hunting in Steamfront Mountains. I'm always
> looking for a group to hunt mino's (great exp, and their axes sell for 4pp
> to other players). Whenever I do a "/ooc Level 10 Bard looking for a
> group" I get no response. Even when there are other level 9-11 players in
> the area. Are we bards no longer a valuable asset in a group? Has anyone
> experienced this?
> ´┐¢
> ´┐¢Tanthalias
> ´┐¢Half Elven Bard
> ´┐¢10th Level
> ´┐¢Tarew Marr
